sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, chronic: initial: 1 mcg/kg (actual body weight) SUBQ once weekly, adjusted weekly in increments of 1 mcg/kg to achieve platelet count of 50 x 10(9)/L or greater; MAX weekly dose 10 mcg/kg
  • Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, chronic: if, following 4 weeks of therapy at the maximum weekly dose of 10 mcg/kg SUBQ, the platelet count is not adequate to control bleeding, discontinue therapy and continue monitoring platelets for 2 weeks following discontinuation

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and effectiveness not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• platelet count greater than 200 x 10(9)/L for 2 consecutive weeks, reduce dose by 1 mcg/kg
  • platelet count greater than 400 x 10(9)/L, do not dose and monitor weekly platelet counts; after platelets fall to less than 200 x 10(9)/L resume at a dose reduced by 1 mcg/kg

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• antibody development has been reported; if suspected, contact Amgen (1-800-772-6436) for assays to detect neutralizing antibodies to romiplostim and thrombopoietin
  • failure to respond or maintain a response may occur; neutralizing antibodies to romiplostim may be present; discontinue treatment if platelet count does not increase to a clinically sufficient level after 4 weeks at the highest dose
  • hepatic impairment, chronic; portal venous thrombosis has been reported
  • myelodysplastic syndrome; risk of disease exacerbation and progression to acute myelogenous leukemia
  • thrombocytopenia, any cause other than chronic immune thrombocytopenia; use not recommended
  • thrombotic and thromboembolic complications may result from excessive platelet count increases; romiplostim should not be used to normalize platelet counts
  • report adverse events to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain (11%), Diarrhea (17%), Indigestion (7%), Nausea (13%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (26%), Backache (13%), Myalgia (14%), Pain in limb (13%)
  • Neurologic:Dizziness (17%), Headache (35%), Insomnia (16%), Paresthesia (6%)
  • Respiratory:Epistaxis (32%), Upper respiratory infection (17%)
  • Other:Fatigue (33%)
Serious
  • Hematologic:Acute myeloid leukemia, Bleeding (12%), Myelofibrosis, Normal reticulin, Increased, Popliteal artery thrombosis, Thrombosis
  • Hepatic:Portal vein thrombosis
  • Other:Acute myeloid leukemia

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Romiplostim, an Fc-peptide fusion protein (peptibody), increases platelet production through binding and activation of the thrombopoietin (TPO) receptor, a mechanism similar to endogenous TPO.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono: dependent on the thrombopoietin receptor on platelets

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    administer subQ only.
  • Subcutaneous
    • use a small-volume syringe with 0.01-mL graduations and verify the syringe contains the correct dose
    • reconstitute vials with correct volume of preservative-free sterile water for injection and gently swirl and invert, do not aggressively agitate or shake
    • do not reconstitute with bacteriostatic water for injection
    • once reconstituted, romiplostim must be administered within 24 hours; discard any unused portion
    • may be used with other medications, including corticosteroids, danazol, azathioprine, intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG), and anti-D immunoglobulin, which may be reduced or discontinued if the platelet count is 50 x 10(9)/L or greater

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• CBC with platelet count; at baseline, weekly during dose adjustment phase, monthly after platelet count has been stable (50 x 10(9) or greater) for at least 4 weeks without dose adjustment, and weekly for at least 2 weeks after treatment discontinuation
  • lack or loss of response; assess for antibodies to romiplostim and other causes

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to continue avoiding situations or medications which increase the risk of bleeding, even with therapy.
  • Drug may cause headache, dizziness, insomnia, myalgia, arthralgia, extremity pain, abdominal pain, dyspepsia, and paresthesia.
  • Advise patient to call healthcare professional if a scheduled dose is missed, as missing a dose may increase the risk of bleeding.
